expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(s.gender) CONTAINS 'female' AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'medicine' RETURN s.knownName ORDER BY p.awardYear ASC LIMIT 1
questions: Who was the first woman to win the Nobel Prize in Medicine?
Which female scientist broke the gender barrier by becoming the inaugural woman laureate in the field of Medicine?
Can you name the pioneering woman who claimed the first-ever Nobel Prize awarded to a female in the medical sciences?
What was the name of the trailblazing female researcher who earned Medicine's first Nobel Prize for a woman?

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE (toLower(s.gender) CONTAINS 'female' OR toLower(s.gender) CONTAINS 'woman') AND toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'medicine' AND p.awardYear <= 2022 RETURN count(DISTINCT s) AS count
questions: How many women had received the Nobel Prize in Medicine by 2022?
What's the total count of female laureates who've been honored with the Medicine Nobel through the end of 2022?
By the time 2022 concluded, how many women had been recognized with Nobel Prizes in Physiology or Medicine?
Up until 2022, what number of female scientists received the prestigious Nobel in the medical field?

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize),(s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)-[:IS_COUNTRY_IN]->(cn:Continent) WHERE p.awardYear <= 2022 WITH cn.name AS continent, count(DISTINCT s.id) AS total ORDER BY total DESC LIMIT 1 RETURN continent
questions: Which continent had the highest total number of laureates up to 2022?
Looking at the geographic distribution of Nobel Prize winners through 2022, which continental region produced the most laureates?
What continent can claim the greatest number of Nobel Prize recipients by the year 2022?
Through 2022, which of Earth's continents dominated in terms of total Nobel laureates born within its borders?

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE p.awardYear <= 2022 MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country) WITH co.name AS country, count(DISTINCT s.id) AS laureateCount ORDER BY laureateCount DESC LIMIT 1 RETURN country, laureateCount
questions: Which country had the most Nobel laureates up to 2022?
What nation has produced the largest number of Nobel Prize winners throughout history up to 2022?
By 2022, which country's citizens had claimed the highest total of Nobel Prizes?
Looking at national origins of laureates through 2022, which country leads the world in Nobel Prize recipients?

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p1:Prize), (s)-[:WON]->(p2:Prize) WHERE toLower(p1.category) CONTAINS toLower('chemistry') AND toLower(p2.category) CONTAINS toLower('peace') RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName
questions: Which Nobel laureate is the only person to win in both Chemistry and Peace?
Who holds the unique distinction of receiving Nobel recognition in both the scientific field of Chemistry and the humanitarian category of Peace?
Can you identify the sole individual who's been awarded Nobel Prizes in two very different domains: Chemistry and Peace?
What's the name of the only laureate who bridged the gap between laboratory science and global diplomacy by winning Nobels in both Chemistry and Peace?

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p2:Prize) WITH s, p2.awardYear AS y2 MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p1:Prize) WHERE p1.awardYear < y2 WITH s, y2, count(DISTINCT p1) AS lessCount WHERE lessCount = 1 WITH s, min(y2) AS secondYear ORDER BY secondYear ASC LIMIT 1 RETURN s.knownName AS knownName
questions: Who was the first laureate to receive two Nobel Prizes?
Which scientist made history by becoming the inaugural recipient of Nobel Prizes on two separate occasions?
Who was the pioneer in winning multiple Nobel Prizes, being the very first person to achieve this remarkable feat?
Can you name the groundbreaking individual who set the precedent by winning not one, but two Nobel Prizes?

answer: Albert Einstein won 1 award: Physics prize awarded in 1921

expected_query: MATCH (s:Scholar) WHERE toLower(s.knownName) CONTAINS 'max planck' OPTIONAL MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WITH s, collect(DISTINCT p.awardYear) AS yrs, count(p) AS c RETURN CASE WHEN c > 0 THEN true ELSE false END AS hasNobel, yrs AS awardYears

answer: The Nobel Laureates in 2010 were Andre Geim, Robert G. Edwards, Ei-ichi Negishi, Richard F. Heck, Peter A. Diamond, Akira Suzuki, Dale T. Mortensen, Konstantin Novoselov, and Christopher A. Pissarides.
